privacy_policy_window.privacy_policy:
EMPLOYEE PRIVACY POLICY

This policy initially applies to the health sector module, which is currently being deployed. It will be adapted for each sector (finance, industry, education, etc.) according to specific requirements.
Some features may be performed using artificial intelligence, always under human supervision.
The NeuroX-TMAX system is compatible with 85% of the world's integrated languages.

At NeuroX-TMAX, protecting your personal data is our absolute priority.

1. Data Collection
We collect only the information necessary to manage your account, provide access to our services, improve your user experience, and fulfill our legal obligations.

2. Use of Data
Your data is used to personalize your experience, manage access, and inform you about news.
It will never be transferred or sold to third parties.

3. Data Transfer
Your data may only be transferred to trusted technical partners or as required by law, in accordance with GDPR requirements.
In the event of further processing outside the EU, standard contractual clauses or equivalent safeguards will be implemented.

4. Your Rights
You can access, correct, or request deletion of your data at any time by contacting us at: dpo@neurogestionjosi.com

5. Security
We apply all necessary measures to protect your data against unauthorized access, loss, or disclosure.

Version 1.1 – 2025-05-28

---

PATIENT PRIVACY POLICY

This policy initially applies to the health sector module, which is currently being deployed. It will be adapted for each sector (finance, industry, education, etc.) according to specific requirements.
Some features may be performed using artificial intelligence, always under human supervision.
The NeuroX-TMAX system is compatible with 85% of the world's integrated languages.

PRIVACY POLICY
PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION - GDPR

Establishment: NeuroX-TMAX
Date of update: 2025-05-28
Version: 2.0 – GDPR 2025 compliant

1. Introduction
We attach great importance to the protection of your personal data. This policy explains how we collect, use, store and protect your information in compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Data Controller: NeuroX-TMAX
DPO Contact: dpo@neurogestionjosi.com

2. Data Collection
During your medical care, we process the following categories of data:

Identification Data:
- First name, last name, date of birth
- Postal address and contact details
- Telephone number, email
- Social security number
- ID document (copy if necessary)

Health Data:
- Medical and family history
- Symptoms and diagnoses
- Prescriptions and treatments
- Medical test results
- Consultation reports
- Medical images (X-ray, MRI, etc.)

Administrative Data:
- Health insurance information
- Billing data
- Appointment history
- Medical correspondence

3. Purpose of Data Processing
We use your personal data only for the following purposes:

Medical Care:
- Establishing a diagnosis
- Implementing and monitoring treatments
- Coordination of care with other specialists
- Emergency management

Administrative Management:
- Appointment planning
- Billing for services
- Interaction with social security bodies
- Management of the medical record

Legal Obligations:
- Compliance with professional duties
- Mandatory public health notifications
- Regulatory retention of medical records
- Responding to judicial requests

Quality Improvement (with your consent):
- Anonymized clinical studies
- Improving the quality of medical services
- Medical staff training

4. Legal Bases for Processing
The processing of your data is based on:
- Medical care: vital interest and public interest task
- Administrative management: contractual performance and legitimate interest
- Legal obligations: compliance with legal and regulatory requirements
- Medical research: explicit (voluntary) consent

5. Data Recipients
Your data may only be shared with the following categories of persons as part of their professional duties:

Medical Staff:
- Treating doctors and specialists
- Authorized medical personnel
- Medical secretaries

Medical Partners:
- Analysis laboratories
- Medical imaging centers
- Pharmacies (for prescriptions)
- Other involved health professionals

Official Bodies:
- Social security and insurance companies
- Health authorities
- Administrations (upon legal request)

Technical Contractors:
- Certified medical data hosters
- IT companies (restricted access)
- Backup service providers

6. Data Transfer
Your data is processed and stored exclusively in France or EU countries, on ANSSI-certified servers.
No transfer to third countries is carried out without your direct consent and appropriate security guarantees.
In the event of further processing outside the EU, standard contractual clauses or equivalent safeguards will be implemented.

7. Retention Periods
Data is stored in accordance with legal requirements:

Data Type         Retention Period
Medical record    20 years after last visit
Medical images    20 years after creation
Administrative data 10 years after end of treatment
Financial documentation 10 years after payment
Medical correspondence 20 years after creation
After these periods: secure destruction or complete anonymization of data.

8. Data Security
We implement strict security measures to protect your data:

Technical measures:
- Encryption of confidential data
- Access via multi-factor authentication
- Regular encrypted backups
- Continuous system monitoring
- Security system updates

Organizational measures:
- Staff privacy training
- Restricted access on a 'need to know' basis
- Regular audits of accesses and procedures
- Signing confidentiality undertakings
- Incident management procedures

Physical measures:
- Secured premises and access control
- Servers in certified data centers
- Protection against intrusions and accidents
- Destruction of physical data carriers

9. Your Rights
Under GDPR you have the following rights regarding your personal data:

Right of access
You may request a copy of all your personal data stored by us.

Right to rectification
You may request correction of inaccurate or incomplete data.

Right to erasure
You may request deletion of your data in legally defined cases (excluding data required by medical or legal requirements).

Right to portability
You may receive your data in a structured format for transmission to another institution.

Right to object
You may object to the processing of your data on legitimate grounds (except where required by law).

Right to restriction of processing
You may request restriction of processing in certain cases.

Right to withdraw consent
If processing is based on your consent, you may withdraw it at any time.

10. Exercising Your Rights
To exercise your rights or obtain data protection advice, contact:
Main contact:
Email: dpo@neurogestionjosi.com
Required information:
- Last name, first name, date of birth
- Copy of identification document
- Description of your request (access, rectification, etc.)
- Justification for deletion (if applicable)
Response time:
We undertake to respond within 30 days of receiving your request.

11. Right to Complain
If you believe your rights have been violated, you may file a complaint with the National Commission on Informatics and Liberties (CNIL):
Website: www.cnil.fr
Phone: 01 53 73 22 22
Address: CNIL – 3 Place de Fontenoy – TSA 80715 – 75334 PARIS CEDEX 07

12. Policy Changes
This policy may change if legislation or our procedures change. All significant changes will be communicated to you:
- Notice in our establishment
- Notification by email (if applicable)
- Update of the QR code for access
Date of last update: 2025-05-28

13. Special Provisions
Incident Management
In the event of a data security breach that could endanger your rights, we will notify you no later than 72 hours after discovery of the incident.

Medical secrecy
Processing of your medical data is subject to medical confidentiality requirements. All our staff are bound by this obligation.

Medical research
Your participation in medical research or projects always requires separate written informed consent.

Teleconsultations
If you use remote consultations, we apply additional measures to protect your data during such exchanges.

Confirmation
By signing the consent form, you confirm:
- You have read and understood this privacy policy
- You consent to the processing of your data as described
- You have been informed of your rights and how to exercise them

For additional questions:
DPO NeuroX-TMAX: dpo@neurogestionjosi.com

Document drafted in accordance with GDPR (EU Regulation 2016/679)
CNIL Recommendations
Version 2.0 – 2025-05-28 – NeuroX-TMAX
